Posted By: stygimoloch (12/5/2008 10:12:27 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really like this guy. At worst, he's a [Howling Mine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Howling Mine), and at best he's a [Phyrexian Arena](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Arena). I don't think you'll use his final ability that much unless you have a milling deck, but his first two abilities are reason enough to play him.
  
   
Jace's one drawback is that he has no way to defend himself. You'll find that he takes a lot of damage because can't spit out tokens every turn to block for him like Elsepth and Garruk do.
posts.html:
I really like this guy. At worst, he's a Howling Mine, and at best he's a Phyrexian Arena. I don't think you'll use his final ability that much unless you have a milling deck, but his first two abilities are reason enough to play him.

Jace's one drawback is that he has no way to defend himself. You'll find that he takes a lot of damage because can't spit out tokens every turn to block for him like Elsepth and Garruk do.

posts.post_content: Let's see... you put Jace for 1UU. Then, you draw a card for free. Next turn, you draw a card for free. Next turn, both you and opponent draw, and here we go again... Most powerful drawing engine to be printed. Ever.

Posted By: macic666 (2/28/2009 4:40:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: even if you're not in a milling deck, jace has the focus to allow you to make an opponent discard 40 cards in 9 turns, combined with the fact that they have 9 extra cards almost 50 cards in there deck would have been used already. the best part is that even though your opponent might have 9 extra cards if you want to hold off on his effect for an extra turn you can have 11 extra cards at your disposal... not too shabby. all in all this guy is a bamf, he's in my opinion one of the top 3 planeswalkers. i do however think that elspeth (precious invincibility for all your cards) and lithiana (all the creatures in the graveyard come into play under your control) still have him for final effects though.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Jace is great, I love him (although the alternative art looks better) but I wish his -1 ability was counter target card, but then his ability would be instant speed, hmm, you know, I think I would be happy if his cost was 2UUU and he used his -1 to counter at instant
  
it feels more blue to be countering then milling, although my mill deck is mono blue ;)

Posted By: Dingo777 (5/6/2009 9:14:09 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Jace is very good, although he might not seem like much compared to other Planeswalkers. What I REALLY love about him, though, is the illustration. His design is astonishing, so menacing... He just radiates power. A frightening power, I might add. The barren background also plays a role here. In my eyes, other Planeswalkers look more like mere legends when compared to him. I consider Jace to be one of the characters with the best design, not just in Magic, but in general.  
  
Oh, and take a look at THIS:  
  
http://www.coolstuffinc.com/images/Products/mtg%20art/Promo/book-jace-beleren.jpg  
  
That's just epic. Kudos to Aleksi Briclot.
posts.html:
